multipleSignersInfo: This action requires multiple signatures. Please provide enough secret keys to meet the threshold.

job.title: Create multisig job (Standard)
job.desc: Standard workflow for productive multisig. Creates a job ID and collects signatures in a distributed manner.
job.short: Creates a multisig job (Job-ID) and collects distributed signatures.

infoBody.one: The transaction is stored as a multisig job in the backend and receives a job ID. Nothing is sent directly.
infoBody.two: Alle nächsten Unterzeichner öffnen in ihrer SKM-Instanz den Menüpunkt „Multisig-Jobs“, laden den Job und unterschreiben.
infoBody.three: Once enough signatures are provided (Threshold erreicht), the transaction will be sent or can be sent.
infoBody.four: Du kannst die Job-ID an weitere Unterzeichner weitergeben oder sie wählen den Job direkt in „Multisig-Jobs“ aus.

steps.one: Step 1: A multisig job is created and receives a job ID.
steps.two: Schritt 2: Alle nächsten Unterzeichner öffnen in ihrer SKM-Instanz den Menüpunkt „Multisig-Jobs“, laden den Job und unterschreiben.
steps.three: Schritt 3: Der zweite Signer öffnet in seiner SKM-Instanz den Menüpunkt „Multisig-Jobs“, lädt den Job und unterschreibt.
steps.four: Step 4: Once enough signatures have been collected, the transaction is sent or can be sent.

local.title: Enter all signatures locally & send directly.
local.desc: Only use if all secret keys can be securely entered on this device (Tests/Recovery/Admin).
local.warning: Warning: All secret keys are being collected in this session. Use only on trusted devices.

infoBody.one: You enter all the required secret keys on this device sequentially until the threshold is reached.
infoBody.two: Das ist kein verteilter Multisig-Flow mehr, sondern „Multi-Key auf einem Gerät“ – nur auf vertrauenswürdigen Geräten nutzen.
infoBody.three: Once enough signatures are collected, the transaction is sent directly to Horizon (ohne Multisig-Job).

xdr.title: Export XDR (nicht senden)
xdr.desc: Generate a raw XDR transaction for offline tools or hardware wallets.
xdr.short: Export the transaction as XDR without sending it directly.
xdr.infoTitle: How does the XDR export work?

infoBody.one: XDR is the raw transaction format of Stellar. Nothing is automatically sent.
infoBody.two: Use XDR for hardware wallets, offline computers, or other wallets/tools that can import XDR.
infoBody.three: You are responsible for signing and/or sending the XDR later (e.g., via Multi-signature jobs or an external tool).

steps.one: An XDR is generated, but nothing is sent.
steps.two: You can externally sign the XDR (Offline-Rechner, Hardware-Wallet, anderes Tool).
steps.three: To send, you need to re-import the XDR (e.g., via multisig jobs or another tool) and sign/send it there.

info.share: Forward the job ID or XDR to the next signers (E-Mail, Messenger wie Telegram/WhatsApp).

info.submit: Wenn genug Signaturen gesammelt sind, sendet einer der Unterzeichner den Job im SKM (Menü „Job-ID“) final an das Netzwerk.

distributed.title: Standard: Distributed Multisig Flow
distributed.body: By default, this session only signs with your own secret key. Additional signatures are supplemented via exported XDR files or a job ID from other signers.

localAll.title: Enter all signatures locally
localAll.body: Choose this option only if you control all secret keys associated with this account (z. B. nach einer Kontorettung mit mehreren Unterzeichnern). The Stellar Account Manager will then collect all signatures locally and send the transaction directly to Horizon.
localAll.checkboxLabel: Enter all signatures locally in this dialogue and send directly.
localAll.warning: Note: If you input all signatures locally, all secret keys will be present in this session. Use this option only on trusted devices.
